decks.notes: The central theme of this deck revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate huge amounts of mana, allowing for the casting of powerful colorless spells like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck is geared towards controlling the board with cards like Oblivion Stone and Walking Ballista, while also disrupting the opponent's graveyard with Relic of Progenitus. The deck also includes ramp spells like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to ensure consistency in assembling the UrzaTron lands.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Ad Nauseam combo, which allows the player to draw their entire deck and win the game with either Laboratory Maniac or Lightning Storm. The deck utilizes fast mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, as well as card draw and selection with Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand. It also includes protection with Pact of Negation and Angel's Grace, and alternate win conditions with Phyrexian Unlife. The goal is to quickly and efficiently combo off before the opponent can disrupt the game plan.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost, evasive Spirit creatures like Supreme Phantom and Rattlechains, supported by anthems like Drogskol Captain. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with counterspells like Spell Queller and protect its own creatures with Selfless Spirit. The inclusion of Collected Company allows for explosive plays and card advantage. The mana base includes fetchlands to ensure timely color fixing and maximize the potential of Cavern of Souls. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy using synergistic Spirit creatures.

The main concept of this Lantern Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by controlling the top of their library and limiting their resources. This is achieved through using cards like Lantern of Insight to manipulate draws, Ensnaring Bridge to prevent attacks, and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck also includes various artifacts like Pithing Needle and Grafdigger's Cage to shut down specific strategies, while utilizing cards like Whir of Invention to tutor for key pieces and ensure the deck's synergy.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing burn spells and aggressive creatures to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The key strategy is to deal damage quickly and efficiently through direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm, while also using creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide to attack the opponent directly. Additionally, cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze serve to disrupt the opponent's plans and deal even more damage. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, consistent damage output.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the board through counter spells and removal, utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to control the game tempo, draw cards, and manage threats efficiently with cards like Cryptic Command, Hieroglyphic Illumination, and Path to Exile. With a mix of control elements and win conditions like Celestial Colonnade, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through card advantage and superior decision-making.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up your graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Goblin Lore to efficiently dump creatures like Gurmag Angler and Flamewake Phoenix into play for massive damage. By utilizing Hollow One's ability to be cast for free if you have cards in hand, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent with a flurry of aggressive creatures. The deck's main goal is to put pressure on your opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game for a fast and decisive victory.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient and versatile Human creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to control the opponent's game plan. Using Aether Vial and mana-fixing lands, the deck can quickly deploy threats and maintain pressure throughout the game. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Reflector Mage provide additional disruption while pumping up the team with Thalia's Lieutenant. The deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on using counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes to control the opponent's creatures and spells, while generating card advantage through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Search for Azcanta. It aims to out-value the opponent by efficiently answering threats and gaining incremental advantage over time. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Celestial Colonnade to close out the game once the opponent's resources are depleted. It is a reactive and controlling strategy that aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent in a long game.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively fill up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting, Goblin Lore, and Burning Inquiry in order to quickly cast powerful creatures like Hollow One, Flamewake Phoenix, and Bloodghast. The deck utilizes the delve mechanic with Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to keep the pressure on the opponent while using cards like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality to control the board. The land base is optimized for quick access to the required colors and to support the aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up infect counters on the opponent's creatures using powerful pump spells and protection spells to ensure the infect damage goes through. Key cards include Noble Hierarch for mana acceleration, Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf as the primary infect creatures, and pump spells like Might of Old Krosa, Become Immense, and Mutagenic Growth. Protection is also crucial, with cards like Blossoming Defense and Vines of Vastwood helping to keep your creatures alive and deal lethal infect damage. The deck's goal is to win the game through infect damage before the opponent can respond effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Cryptic Command, Terminus, and Path to Exile, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and limit the opponent's resources. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides additional card advantage and win conditions. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent while maintaining control of the game.
